H0.text: Shinier is the characteristic of a model of the Moon that makes it different from a model of Earth.

H1.text: Heavier is the property that distinguishes a model of the Moon from a model of Earth, making the two models different.

H2.text: Smaller is the characteristic of the Moon model that makes it differ from the Earth model.

H3.text: Rougher is the characteristic that makes a model of the Moon different from a model of Earth.

A4.text: The Moon is a relatively large, terrestrial, planet-like natural satellite, with a diameter about one-quarter of Earth's.

A5.text: The Moon's mass is 1‚ÅÑ81 of Earth's, being the second densest among the planetary moons.

A6.text: The reflectance (albedo) of the Moon's surface is comparable to that of asphalt.
